data.chText: 沉船；严重损毁的船
data.enText: a ship that has sunk or that has been very badly damaged

data.chText: （事故中）遭严重毁坏的汽车（或飞机等）
data.enText: a car, plane, etc. that has been very badly damaged in an accident

data.chText: 有两名乘客仍被困在失事的车辆里。
data.enText: Two passengers are still trapped in the wreck.

data.chText: （身体或精神上）受到严重损伤的人
data.enText: a person who is in a bad physical or mental condition

data.chText: 从身体上说，我完全是一个废人。
data.enText: Physically, I was a total wreck.

data.chText: 这次面试使得他的精神高度紧张。
data.enText: The interview reduced him to a nervous wreck .

data.chText: 状况非常糟糕的车辆（或建筑物等）
data.enText: a vehicle, building, etc. that is in very bad condition

data.chText: 我们买下这座房子时，它破烂不堪。
data.enText: The house was a wreck when we bought it.

data.chText: 他们仍然希望从他们破碎的婚姻中挽回点什么。
data.enText: They still hoped to salvage something from the wreck of their marriage.

data.chText: 汽车 / 火车失事
data.enText: a car/train wreck

data.chText: 破坏；损坏；毁坏
data.enText: to damage or destroy sth

data.chText: 那座楼房被炸毁了。
data.enText: The building had been wrecked by the explosion.

data.chText: 公路上到处都弃置着被撞坏的汽车。
data.enText: The road was littered with wrecked cars.

data.chText: 毁灭；毁掉
data.enText: to spoil sth completely

data.chText: 天气把我们的计划全都毁了。
data.enText: The weather wrecked all our plans.

data.chText: 一次重伤差点儿葬送了他的前程。
data.enText: A serious injury nearly wrecked his career.

data.chText: 使（船舶）失事；使遇难；使下沉
data.enText: to damage a ship so much that it sinks or can no longer sail

data.chText: 那艘船在法国的沿岸失事。
data.enText: The ship was wrecked off the coast of France.

data.chText: 以上各词均含碰撞、撞击之义，尤指撞车。
data.enText: These are all words that can be used when sth, especially a vehicle, hits sth else very hard and is damaged or destroyed.
crash

data.chText: 指（使）物体或交通工具碰撞或撞击：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to hit an object or another vehicle, causing damage; to make a vehicle do this

data.chText: 飞机会失事把我吓坏了。
data.enText: I was terrified that the plane would crash.
slam (sth) into/against sb/sth

data.chText: 指（使）重重地撞上：
data.enText: to crash into sth with a lot of force; to make sth do this

data.chText: 汽车打滑，重重地撞到树上。
data.enText: The car skidded and slammed into a tree.
collide

data.chText: 指交通工具或人碰撞、相撞或撞上：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) (of two vehicles or people) to crash into each other; (of a vehicle or person) to crash into sb/sth else

data.chText: 那辆小轿车和货车在浓雾中迎面相撞。
data.enText: The car and the van collided head-on in thick fog.
smash

data.chText: 指（使）猛烈撞击、猛烈碰撞或撞车：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to crash into sth with a lot of force; to make sth do this; to crash a car

data.chText: 飙车抢劫者驾着偷来的汽车撞破商店橱窗。
data.enText: Ramraiders smashed a stolen car through the shop window.

data.chText: 用crash、slam还是smash？
crash尤指交通工具碰撞，可不与介词连用：
data.enText: Crash is used particularly for vehicles and can be used without a preposition.

data.chText: 我们要坠毁了，是不是？
data.enText: We're going to crash, aren't we?

data.chText: slam和smash表示此义时总是与介词连用：
data.enText: In this meaning slam and smash always take a preposition.
We're going to slam/smash, aren't we?

data.chText: 两词均可用于除交通工具外的范围更广的事物。crash与介词连用也可用于其他事物：
data.enText: They are used for a much wider range of things than just vehicles. Crash can also be used for other things, if used with a preposition.

data.chText: 他砰的一声将电话听筒摔下来。
data.enText: He crashed down the telephone receiver.
crash, slam or smash?
wreck

data.chText: 指使交通工具撞坏或毁坏
data.enText: to crash a vehicle and damage it so badly that it is not worth repairing
The two vehicles crashed/collided.
The two vehicles crashed/slammed/smashed into each other .
The car/plane crashed/slammed/smashed into a tree.
I've crashed/smashed/wrecked the car .
to crash/slam/collide/smash head-on (into/with sth)

means: (事故中)遭严重毁坏的汽车(或飞机等)
(身体或精神上)受到严重损伤的人

tr: a ship that has been destroyed at sea
a serious accident (usually involving one or more vehicles)
example: they are still investigating the crash of the TWA plane

tr: an accident that destroys a ship at sea
something or someone that has suffered ruin or dilapidation
example: the house was a wreck when they bought it
thanks to that quack I am a human wreck
The kid busted up the car

value.def: To wreck something means to completely destroy or ruin it.

example.ex: A coalition could have defeated the government and wrecked the treaty...
example.tran: 联盟本来可以击败政府并毁掉该条约的。

example.ex: His life has been wrecked by the tragedy.
example.tran: 他的生活被这场灾难毁掉了。
错过的提升机会，失去的工作，破裂的婚姻

example.ex: They may be remembered as the wreckers of a fine company.
example.tran: 他们也许会因为搞垮一家好公司而留下恶名。

value.def: If a ship is wrecked, it is damaged so much that it sinks or can no longer sail.

example.ex: The ship was wrecked by an explosion.

value.def: A wreck is something such as a ship, car, plane, or building which has been destroyed, usually in an accident.

example.ex: The car was a total wreck...
We thought of buying the house as a wreck, doing it up, then selling it.
example.tran: 我们想过把这栋房子当作废弃建筑买下来，修缮一下，然后再卖掉。

value.tran: 失事的船只(或汽车、飞机);损毁的建筑

value.def: A wreck is an accident in which a moving vehicle hits something and is damaged or destroyed.

example.ex: He was killed in a car wreck.
...the little girl that survived that plane wreck...
example.tran: 在空难中幸存的小女孩

example.ex: What would he tell his parents if he had a wreck?
example.tran: 如果他出了事故，他怎么向他的父母交代？

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 crash

value.def: If you say that someone is a wreck, you mean that they are very exhausted or unhealthy.

example.ex: It was embarrassing and sad to see this man reduced to a mumbling wreck.
example.tran: 看见这个人变得口齿不清、弱不禁风，真是让人既难堪又悲哀。

value.tran: 精疲力竭的人;身体状况极差的人

trans: 极度神经质的人;极度精神紧张的人
